head.title: A Call for Articles On Safe Driving Issues

hedline.hl1: A Call for Articles On Safe Driving Issues

abstract.p: Naomi Norman letter on recent articles mentioning poor driving habits suggests article extolling virtues of safe, courteous driving (S)

block.p: You've recently run articles that seem to exalt dangerous driving. One rhapsodized about the power women feel behind the wheel of massive sport utility vehicles. I see these women every day -- driving carelessly, ignoring speed zones, yakking on cell phones and not even bothering to make sure their kids are in seat belts.
Then you featured an article on Iris Kalt, with a breezy (almost admiring) description of her incredibly unsafe and selfish driving habits.

Then you featured an article on Iris Kalt, with a breezy (almost admiring) description of her incredibly unsafe and selfish driving habits.
How about an article extolling the virtues of safe, courteous driving -- like not using a cell phone, obeying speed limits and stopping for pedestrians in crosswalks?
